messages.message:
Anyone having this problem when trying to run repo service?
```
go: downloading github.com/apache/thrift (http://github.com/apache/thrift) v0.0.0-20181129202844-0dd823580c78
go: verifying github.com/apache/thrift@v0.0.0-20181129202844-0dd823580c78 (http://github.com/apache/thrift@v0.0.0-20181129202844-0dd823580c78): checksum mismatch
	downloaded: h1:sH/VyznViECLgYKhgRuNoAkUTKZeT0u0kA5NzMP4mkg=
	go.sum:     h1:eY2r0ysh+ix3JitXrXlagv/AH+2nlAGWrlBrU42k7Bc=
make: *** [runlocal] Error 1
```
Delete the go.sum file from the src folder of that service, that always works for me when I have this issue
(:grimacing: <- if you're gonna rm, rm big, amirite? :p)

I think this resolves slightly more correctly if you do sudo rm -rf repo-service/src/go/pkg/mod/cache (or something with the cache in the path), instead of the go.sum file. This is a mismatch between your local cache and the correct md5 hash.
